meanings.definition: The action of officially preventing someone from doing something.
meanings.sent1: The debarments of the student from the school event were necessary for safety.
meanings.sent2: After multiple warnings, the debarments from the library were enforced.
meanings.sent3: The debarments from the playground led to a creative indoor play session.
meanings.sent4: Her debarments from the dance floor felt like invisible chains holding her back.
meanings.sent5: The debarments of the dog from the kitchen were marked by his sad puppy eyes.

meanings.definition: The state of being officially prevented from doing something.
meanings.sent1: His debarments from the club made him feel excluded from his friends.
meanings.sent2: The debarments of the employee from using company resources were clearly stated in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The debarments from eating sweets made her appreciate fruits more.
meanings.sent4: The debarments from the internet left him feeling disconnected from the world.
meanings.sent5: The debarments of the bird from flying freely saddened the children in the park.
